messages.content: ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt is a custom node that helps you understand what you're prompting for each property as you build your prompts.
How many properties does ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt currently support?
Is there a mandatory property in ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt?
Yes, Base is the mandatory property in ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt.
Can ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt be used with other nodes?

Yes, ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt can be used with [CLIP Text Encode (Prompt)](https://blenderneko.github.io/ComfyUI-docs/Core%20Nodes/Conditioning/CLIPTextEncode/) and the Show Text item in [ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts](https://github.com/pythongosssss/ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts).
What should be checked to connect ScenarioPrompt to a prompt?
To connect ScenarioPrompt to a prompt, you must check the **Convert text to input** box for CLIP Text Encode (Prompt).
How is ScenarioPrompt's autocomplete feature inspired?

ScenarioPrompt's autocomplete feature is inspired by the source codes from [ComfyUI - CustomNode Unlimited Prompt](https://github.com/PluMaZero/ComfyUI-SpaceFlower) and [NovelAI.app](https://github.com/gangjun06/NovelAI.app).
Where can I find the tags used for autocomplete in ScenarioPrompt?
The tags used for autocomplete in ScenarioPrompt are based on NovelAI.app's googlesheet.
To install ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt, navigate to your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory and clone the repository using `git clone https://github.com/Ludobico/ComfyUI-ScenarioPrompt.git`.
What are the references for ScenarioPrompt?
The references for ScenarioPrompt are [NovelAI.app](https://github.com/gangjun06/NovelAI.app) and [ComfyUI-SpaceFlower](https://github.com/PluMaZero/ComfyUI-SpaceFlower).
